alert.note: Alert for Marathon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 10:07PM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Wolf River near Shiocton affecting Shawano, Waupaca and Outagamie Counties. Wisconsin River below Wausau affecting Marathon County. Menominee River near McAllister affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. Wolf River at New London affecting Waupaca, Outagamie and Winnebago Counties. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Pembine, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lower Wolf River...including Shiocton, New London, Lake Poygan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wisconsin River below Wausau. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1167.0 feet, Water approaches buildings in DC Everest Park and Oak Island Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 1167.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:10 PM CDT Saturday was 1167.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 1167.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon.
